titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael. I-1) Homily of Timothy (Dämatewos) archbishop of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 3ra-8va); miracle (fols. 9ra-10rb); ʾarke hymn I (fol. 10rb); ʾarke hymn II (fols. 10rb-10va) I-2) Homily of bishop John (Yoḥannǝs) for the 12th of Taḫśaś (fols. 10va -16ra); miracle (fols. 16rb-17ra); ʾarke hymn I (fols. 17ra -17rb); ʾarke hymn II (fol. 17rb); ʾarke hymn III (fols. 17rb-17va); ʾarke hymn IV (fol. 17va) I-3) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Ṭǝrr (fols. 17va-26rb); miracle (fols. 26va-27ra); ʾarke hymn (fol. 27ra-27rb l.1) I-4) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Yäkkatit (fols. 27rb-30va); miracle (fols. 30va-31va); ʾarke hymn I (fols. 31va-31vb); ʾarke hymn II (fol. 31vb) I-5) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 31vb-47va); miracle (fols. 47va-49rb); ʾarke hymn I (fols. 49rb); ʾarke hymn II (fols. 49rb-49va) I-6) Homily of Rǝtuʿa Haymanot for the 12th of Miyazya (fols. 49va-54va); miracle (fols. 54vb-56va) I-7) Homily of John (Yoḥannǝs) bishop of Ethiopia for the 12th of Gǝnbot (fols. 57va-58rb l.2); miracle (fols. 58rb-59va l.1) I-8) Homily of John (Yoḥannǝs) bishop of Aksum for the 12th of Säne (fols. 59va-63vb); miracle (fols. 63vb-64va) I-9) Homily of bishop John (Yoḥannǝs) for the 12th of Ḥamle (fols. 64va-68rb); miracle (fols. 68rb-69ra) I-10) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Näḥase (fols. 69ra-71rb); miracle (fols. 71rb-72ra) I-11) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Mäskäräm (fols. 72ra-74rb); miracle (fols. 74rb-74vb) I-12) Anonymous homily for the 12th of Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 74vb-78rb); miracle (fols. 78rb-78vb) I-13) Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 78vb-79rb); ʾArke (fol. 79rb) I-14) Commemorative notice for [Taḫśaś] (fols. 79rb-79vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 79vb-80ra) I-15) Commemorative notice for [Ṭǝrr] (fols. 80ra-80rb l.2); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 80rb) I-16) Commemorative notice for [Yäkkatit] (fols. 80rb-80va); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 80va-80vb) I-17) Commemorative notice for [Mäggabit] (fol. 80vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 80vb-81ra) I-18) Commemorative notice for [Miyazya] (fols. 81ra-81rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 81rb) I-19) Commemorative notice for [Gǝnbot] (fols. 81rb-81va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 81vb) I-20) Commemorative notice for [Säne] (fols. 81vb-82va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 82va) I-21) Commemorative notice for [Ḥamle] (fols. 82va-82vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 82vb-83ra l.2) I-22) Commemorative notice for [Näḥase] (fol. 83ra); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 83ra -83rb) I-23) Commemorative notice for [Mäskäräm] (fols. 83rb-83va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 83va) I-24) Commemorative notice for [Ṭǝqǝmt] (fols. 83va-84ra); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 84ra-84rb).
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: The scribe’s name Wäldä Śǝllase is mentioned in the supplication formula in fol. 78rb.

donors.donor: The name of the donor Wäldä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus is mentioned in the supplication formula on fols. 8vb, 84ra. Other two names, Täsfa Maryam (e.g. fols. 8vb, 9ra, 59vb) and ʿAmdä Mikaʾel (fol. 10rb) are also mentioned in the supplication formula.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with a wire and a piece of textile. Many folios are stained with water. Fols. 1, 2 are damaged; the outer margin of fol. 85 is cut.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold close to the head and the tail of the quires.

squires.squire: A (2/fols. 1r-2v) – I (9; s.l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 3r-11v) – II (8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; s.l.: 6, stub after 2/fols. 12r-19v) – III (8/fols. 20r-27v) – IV (10/fols. 28r-37v) – V (8/fols. 38r-45v) – VI (10/fols. 46r-55v) – VII (10/fols. 56-65) – VIII (10/fols. 66r-75) – IX (10; s.l.: 1, stub after 9; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; s.l.: 7, stub after 4; s.l.: 10, stub before 1/fols. 76r-85).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the second part of names of the donor and the scribe; some lines in the incipit page of the text alternating with black lines; two initial lines of all sections; the word sälam “peace”; the initial word for the ʾarke; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.cont: Fol. 84v: Magic prayer against the destruction of harvest by hail.
additional.add: Fol. 84v: በስመ፡ አብ፡ በል፡ ጸሎተ፡ በረድ፡ ምድምያስ፡ ፫ጊዜ …
additional.tran: Fol. 84v: Pray “Bä-səmä ˀAb“ recite “ṣälotä bäräd mədəmyas” three times …
additional.det: Crude written in violet ink, partly unreadable.

extras.extra: - Writing exercises: fols. 1r, 1v, 2r, 2v. - Pen trial in fol. 1v. - Name of the donor(?) are erased on some fols. e.g. 3ra, 16ra, 25ra. - A note is washed out: fol. 84rb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margins: - zä-Ḫǝdar (fol. 3r) - zä-Taḫśaś (fols. 10v) - mǝnbab zä-Ṭǝrr (fol. 17v) - zä-Yäkkatit (fol. 27r) - zä-Mäggabit (fol. 31v) - zä-Miyazya (fol. 49v) - zä-Gǝnbot (fol. 56v) - zä-Säne (fol. 59v) - zä-Ḥamle (fol. 64v) - zä-Näḥase (fol. 69r) - zä-Mäskäräm (fol. 72r) - zä-Ṭǝqǝmt (fol. 74v) - zä-Ḫǝdar (fol. 78v) - zä-Taḫśaś (fols. 79r) - mǝnbab zä-Ṭǝrr (fol. 80r) - zä-Yäkkatit (fol. 80r) - zä-Mäggabit (fol. 80v) - zä-Miyazya (fol. 81r) - zä-Gǝnbot (fol. 81r) - zä-Säne (fol. 81v) - zä-Ḥamle (fol. 82v) - zä-Näḥase (fol. 83r) - zä-Mäskäräm (fol. 83r) - zä-Ṭǝqǝmt (fol. 83v)
